pages.text: Alloygery introduces a completely new and customizable way to craft armor. All armor starts as a base layer. You can later upgrade your base armor with armor plates made from various materials.

pages.title: Base Armor Types
pages.text: Alloygery adds three base armor types: Wool, Leather, and Chain.

pages.title: Upgrading Your Armor
pages.text: You can add plates to your base armor to upgrade its durability, protection, and other stats. The image depicts Steel Plating applied to each base armor type.

pages.title: Crafting Armor Plates
pages.text: Crafting armor plating is easily done at the $(l:block_smithing_anvil)Smithing Anvil$().

pages.title: Applying Armor Plates
pages.text: Once you have crafted some armor plating, you can add it to your base armor at the $(l:block_smithing_table)Smithing Table$().

pages.title: What About Diamond Armor?
pages.text: This way of making armor doesn't include diamond or netherite armor. If you happen to come across some as loot, you can make armor plates from them in the $(l:block_smithing_anvil)Smithing Anvil$().

pages.title: Removing Plates
pages.text: You can remove the plating from your armor at any time by using a $(thing)Crafting Hammer$() at a $(thing)Crafting Table$().
